# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text, " ")
        if length(string(word)) + length(lines) > text_width
            push!(lines, "")
        end
        push!(lines, word)
    end
    return join(lines, "\n"))
end

# Example usage:
text = "Hello, world! This is a long example sentence that might need to be wrapped to fit within a maximum text width."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 15)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This `wrap_string` function takes a string and a maximum text width. It iterates over each word in the text, checking if adding it to the current line would exceed the text_width. If so, it starts a new line.

In the example provided, the wrapped_text will be broken into lines with a maximum width of 15 characters (the value passed as `text_width`).
